name: Blameless
description: Blameless is a mysterious first-person adventure with primary focus on puzzle solving and short story. The player will appear in a role of an architect trying to investigate strange happenings, after discovering evidence of an act of violence.
minimum_requirements: 最低配備: 作業系統: Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8 處理器: 1.9 GHz Intel Core i5 記憶體: 4 GB 記憶體 顯示卡: Video card with 512 MB memory 儲存空間: 1200 MB 可用空間
recommended_requirements: 建議配備: 作業系統: Windows 10 處理器: 2.3 GHz Intel Core i7 記憶體: 8 GB 記憶體 顯示卡: Video card with 1024 MB memory 儲存空間: 1200 MB 可用空間

reviews.review_text: Nice short game with decent graphics and smooth gameplay.  There is a bug in the first part, when any item is dropped on the blood I cannot pick it up again, instead it zoom in the blood.

I can't really bring myself to give the game a negative rating seeing as it seems to be the first effort from a one-man studio. I'll just say that while it's nice for what it is, there isn't really much to it. Since it's free you should still check it out if you like trying out beginner game projects.  +The visuals are simple in nature but lit realistically, so the game looks pretty convincing aside from a few out-of-place assets, reminds me somewhat of the visuals in the PS2 Silent Hill titles. Assuming this is the creator's work and isn't a Unity store asset flip, it's pretty impressive. +The interactivity is well put together. >There's multiple ways to complete the puzzles, but   all paths seem to lead to the same ending, that hints that there might be more coming.   -Short, doesn't explain much,   seems to be a set-up to a bigger game.   -Bugged out at one point: While inspecting the piece of paper in the tool shed my flashlight got stuck and just hung in the air, but could still be used by hitting 'F' which would make it appear and disappear.  Good for a first project, serves pretty well as a proof-of-concept for a larger game if that was the intention.

It's a pretty good narrative horror, and considering it's free I say go for it!  It has a few ways to end the game, various ways to do certain things. It's not just go from a to b and have story done.
Decent but weird story... much enjoyable though. Challenging puzzles... Easy achievements & it is for free! Thank you Devs!

A short but very competent atmospheric game. The puzzles are fairly easy and use simple logic to be completed. The game is free so there is no harm in trying it for yourself. I hope the developers continue the story or create more (and longer) games.

First of all i would like to say thanks for this game it's a little (FREE) gem. A first person horror, adventure puzzle combination it was a bit short but enjoyable for me. I enjoyed the story it had a good level of puzzle solving to progress and a bit of a spooky feel in some parts. The graphics were decent enough the narration very good the puzzles were obvious with a little bit of thought but you are still kept intrested and want to continue. I played mine on my laptop i3 4gb ram dedicated graphics card win 10 and it ran very smooth with no glitches so you don't need i5 or i7 like it states. I played through twice so as to get the last achievement i missed the reader when you click on a note to read it click it again and it will read it to you then you will get that achievement.......  Overall I would recommend this game it's well worth the hour or so playing :)

I think this game's brilliant. I was expecting a lot of jump scares or action because of the tension that the game builds. There's also a lot of times where the killer could have came into the game a bit more but that's my opinion I guess. Decent game, especially when it's free.  Is there a good ending? Replayed and got the same outcome

A surprisingly effective short horror experience, with some mild puzzle-em-up action thrown in for good measure. It's not as terrifying as most other horror games, but still manages to evoke a genuinely creepy and unsettling atmosphere, whilst - crucially - not outstaying its welcome. Definitely one of the better free games on Steam, and well worth the half hour or so it'll take you to complete it.
Just one word: awesome! Please, please more of this game!

This was a great short game. I love games like this where it is very paced and full of mystery. I was a little dissapointed with the shortness, but who am I to say when it was provided for free! Note to the developer: It would be great to see you (or your team and you) make a long experience of a game of this style. Thanks for the experience!

This game has decent graphics, decent music, sound quality and effects and interesting game puzzle solving mechanics (although buggy here and there), narration was little weak, but not terrible in my opinion. Overall it felt like a decent foundation for a good game. Unfortunately, when I was thinking of what secrets this game holds and curiosity pushed me forward while the suspense was building up and my instinct of self preservation screamed at me to be careful as I slowly progressed through the dark places not knowing what exactly should I expect and then I finally managed to escape, I was pretty soon confronted with the sad truth that this game is just that - a good foundation for a good game, but not much else. I wish this game was longer, I wish there was more to it. Honestly, I did not read the description of the game prior to playing, I wanted to be surprised, but I can't lie, when I realized this game is just a short story, I was disappointed. After playing this game, I had mixed feelings. I'm not exactly a fan of short story games. I can't help but think of this game as of Duty Calls: The Calm Before the Storm version of Outlast. Even the meaningless stick and the 500 sheets of wide-ruled notebook paper have their counterparts here, but perhaps that is just my misunderstanding of the short story games... The ultimate question I obviously have to answer is whether I would recommend this game to anyone or not. Well, despite my own disappointment, I am open minded and I would like to support what little good was brought for free in this title, so that's the main reason why this review is positive. Good luck to the creators of this game, thank you for this little game and I hope to see more games from you, hopefully longer games next time! :-)  6/10

First thing you're going to notice: the graphics are actually pretty nice, and the game gives the overall feeling that it's been worked on with care: the environement, though not really expensive or original, is full of details that make it believable, from the effects to the textures and models of objects. It's neat. I like the fact that at least on one place, you have two ways of solving a problem. The puzzles aren't very complicated or based on particularly great mechanics, but they feel natural enough, and I could care for a longer experience with that type of gameplay.  Because it's not going to take a long moment of your life to traverse. And quite honestly, I just don't get what the ending is suppose to say. The build up is okay for that type of short experience, but it goes pretty much nowhere.  It's free, you can totally try it. It's worth the hour (or less) you are going to spend on it. I just hope the devs are working on a more 'complete' game in terms of story at least.
Overall a fantastic free to play game, stunning graphics along with plenty of mind ♥♥♥♥ing puzzles
Feels rushed, I wouldn't bother when there are better games....It's free I guess, until you drop an item and it goes through the floor and have to restart.

I know it's free and all but... it is very buggy. The voice acting makes me cringe (the cop does a better job than the main character). And with there being absolutely no instruction, I grossly underestimated the complexity of the puzzles in the game. But then once I figured out the first one, all the rest were way too easy. I found the first ending, going over the scaffolding. I tried to get out the garage for another ending, but I got hit by the guy, and when it loaded my check point, I kept falling through the floor into nothingness. So, I have no idea how that will end. But don't really care enough to play it again... Also, devs, as cool as lens flares are, if you're trying to make it a realistic first person experience, keep in mind the human eye doesn't see lens flares. So unless you're supposed to be seeing all this through a camera, there was no need for a lens flare on the moon.

Short but pretty good game, story lacks a little explaining, but I assume there will be a second chapter that will clear more information out.  Graphics are okay, Puzzles are okay, I would however like to see more than one solution.  But overall a good short game.

Good short story with amazing visuals. Decent jump scare if you aren't waiting for something like that to happen.  Though storywise, he would have been able to just tell the police to pull his call history from his provider. That is enough evidence for the police to have to at least look into it.
stock in the first room and felt tired and dizy because of poor FOV and bad mouse sensivity :(

Wow... I must say that I am rather impressed!  Yes, it is short and not so terrifying, but it is quite fun to play.  A free, good looking game, with a couple of easy to earn achievements?  Yeah, no one's complaining here.  Props to you, devs!   Considering the bigger piles of excrement sitting out there, this one is a shimmering gem. I enjoyed myself while playing.

Disclaimer: this is my opinion and also, I am just giving some ideas for the developers  1. This game isnt scary 2. I was expecting a little bit longer of a game the game took me litterally only 1 hour to finish even with me pausing the game and be afk for 2-5 mins  But I do respect the game for its puzzles it did took me awhile to figure them out and in my opinion there should be some back story. Maybe something like the murdered woman's side of the story or the murderer's side of the story would be awesome.

Ok, this is not a full game, it's not even half game. It's a 15 min demo/playable trailer promo. That said, the gameplay is good , has an interesting storyline too. Sad thing is, it takes longer to download than to play, but it's free so.....
Terrible voice acting but it's a good game worth the try 7/10
nice but short
Ending was terrible, the puzzles were too easy. Overall not impressed.
Not so bad, except for the horrible ending.
the game looks good and all but...when i want to skip it wont let me skip when i press enter to play it wont work!?

I could go either way with this review: one one side it's a (mostly) solo project, and it's free, so who am I to criticize? But disregarding that, I certainly don't feel it's worth the very positive rating it enjoys at the moment. It's really not a good game at all.  That said, the ending is amusing, and that payoff makes it worth the short playthrough.  The bad parts are: nauseating camera movement, confusing and frustrating game mechanics, graphics from 2003, bad sound design, bad lighting, bad voice acting, useless jumping, having to do multiple mouse clicks to complete reading notes or opening some locks, some useless objects to interact with, lots of objects you can't interact with even though it looks as if you'd be able to, some bugs like not being to pick up objects placed on a place of interest, illogical inventory system, unnecessary male voiceover might be alientating for female players.  The game actually feels like someone's practice attempt att level design, which barely works, but, as I suggested above: if you start it, be sure to complete it (there are gudies here at steam, if you get stuck).
short but very fun horror, puzzle game. Would recommend to anyone
T WAS A MEH.
for me its a nice game but way to short. i like the graphic and the story but only 30 min gameplay srsly?
short and stupid

This game has a good atmosphere and is actually petty scary, but it has so much of a lack of direction that it took me 2 hours (yes I know steam says I only have 0.9 hours, but that's because steam did its weird thing where it doesn't say the actual amount of time you played the game) to just get past the first part, and that was after I gave up and looked up what to do. The graphics are actually pretty good, but it's hard to find some objects because they blend in with the back-ground, rendering them nearly impossible to see. There really isn't much of a heavy plot-line and such, so if you want a game with a really deep plot you probably shouldn't probably get this.  So in conclusion I'd like to say that for a free game, it's pretty good, but if you want a really involving game to play this isn't the game for you.  Extra: They're probably going to fix some of what I said in future updates, so if you really want this wait till they update it a bit more.
Nice short mystery thriller game. A couple of bugs are being ironed out but it's very entertaining! Did have a few scares.
Good ideas, poor execution, poor presentation. Not worth the time, honestly. It's just a shame to see such good ideas go to waste.
It only took a few minutes before event triggers got messed up and my character started repeating himself about things that had already happened.

I did play some horror indie and this game caught my attention Unfortunately, I didn't even finish the first room after wondering about 30 minutes. How you suppose to know there a hatch above the ceiling.  AT LEAST, please give a working dialogue that give tiny bit of clue on what to do next.The dialogue seems not doing that much( based on my experience in first room). A little popup on the corner that said ' Find other escape route from underground' might help bad puzzle solver like me. No mechanic tutorial or whatsoever But it's free, worth of try If you want to experience indie game with average story and mild horror element I did end up watch the whole play through from YouTube.
a neat little game that's FREE. Wish it had a alt ending though.
Very good game. Totaly recomended for some1 who finally wants to play a good game )
Man this game is intense as hell.

Found it very disturbing but fascinating too. Only played the first part of the game the music really creeped me out. For what it is and for those not afraid of stuff like this I would say its ok to play. For me too creepy and scary!!!!

While the intent behind the game is good, the way they went about doing wasn't. I got this game thinking that it was going to be scary. However, as I learned, it wasn't scary. To me it was a bit boring for some sort of scary feeling. As for the puzzle solving that was the saving grace for me. I personally wouldn't recommend it to one of my adult friends, but would recommend this to a teenager or tween. To me it is so non-threatening that I would allow a young child play the game. If they make or are making a #2, I hope they up the fear factors in the game.

Game is short, but what do you expect from a free game. I spent most of my time trying to find my way out of the property. There really is no way other than glitching the game to climb something. I would not recomend this game because it does not really have anything really story wise.
The game keep crashing every time i'm starting it...

The game is good, it's just way to short and it seems incomplete, 15 min till completion. I spent some more time playing it from the start again to search for alternative endings, however it turned out to be a waste of time.
Free or not, a game that ends in 25 minutes isn't worth my energy....
I feel bad for not recommending this game because it is free but it is so unstable that it crashes 5 seconds in game for no reason.

♥♥♥♥ whoever made this game Seriously i just wasted 33 minutes of my ♥♥♥♥in' life  Let's be honest the game is just a weird puzzle ♥♥♥♥...  I don't recommend people playing this game! it's an absolute ♥♥♥♥! don't even try this piece of ♥♥♥♥  There's a weird ♥♥♥♥in' bug in the game that prevents you from finishing the game which absolutely sucks  The game already sucks and they failed at it they have one ♥♥♥♥in' job to make it even less ♥♥♥♥!  Here's my Actual Review:  Story -0/10 Dialogue/Voice - 3.2/10 Puzzle - Deepshit  Note to the developer: Go ♥♥♥♥ yourself idiot ♥♥♥♥♥! give me my 33 minutes of my life back plus 10 minutes for writing this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ review of this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game! Okay, so I finally played completely through this 'game' and have actual constructive feedback to give on the following grounds:     'If you were a friend of mine, would I actually tell you to check this game out?'
Do i reccomend this game? Yes!  was it worth the 30mins that i took to play it?. yes!  was it full of atsmoshpere?. yes!  will i sleep tonight? no!

I think based on what the Dev had to work with, they did an pretty ok job. The game feels very good in the sense that it possesses a creepy atmosphere, and the controls are very easy. While the voice acting is by no means fantastic, I have certainly heard worse. the music is minimal but it fits in fine. Figuring out the puzzles was not difficult, but that's subjective. If you're good at solving puzzles, this game may not be challenging for you. If you just looking for a bit of fun (an hour at most), then this may suit you. Unfortunatly, while there are two routes to reaching the end, the end is exactly the same no matter how you get there. There are no moral choices to be made, and how you solve the puzzels seems to not make a difference. The overarching mystery will remain unsolved no matter what you do, which I find disappointing. This game is more aimed at an escape rather than uncoving the mystery. That said, considering it is a free game, and the fact that it works fine (no crashing, only one point that caused a noticable FPS drop, and only one or two non-game-breaking visual bugs), I would say if you think you may enjoy it, there is no harm in giving it a try. I have given this a thumbs up just because I thought it was good enough for a free game and it's a very shor experience.

This game is very very short even for a free game, but there is potential here in a very atmospheric and cool game, I would love to see more and happily pay for chapters or something if they were a decent length.

Very pleasant. If you like games like Slender: The Arrival and other (even not horror) first person puzzles, you should try this. Game is quite well polished, although I accidentaly skipped one or two puzzles.  10/10 Kidnapped Construction Worker Simulator 2016
Great game! Amazing graphics and fun puzzles ;b Purfect length as well, not too long or too short.

So, from what I understand of the story, this game is a prequel to an upcoming game by Vaclav Hudec (it's hinted at in the final cutscene). In that case, I'm going to write this review in the context of constructive criticism and give feedback as to what can be improved for the full game.  (spoilers ahead)  Firstly, something I love about this game is its atmosphere. I dreaded each creepy hallway and spooked myself on a number of occasions. This anticipation, of course, made the man at the end seem a whole lot more terrifying. The atmosphere felt very similar to Outlast's, and I can basically describe this game as a puzzle-oriented Outlast.  That said, the puzzles were a bit wonky. I like the idea that each puzzle can be solved in a variety of ways; however, I found myself more often than not searching the room twenty times over because I couldn't find an important object. The placement of key items could be a bit more intelligent (though some objects were cleverly situated, like the pipe in the first room being in the center of the spotlight you could turn on) or there could be more creative item combinations. If you're going to have a variety of interactable objects in a room, why not invent multiple solutions using all those objects? That might even up the complexity of each puzzle, interestingly. In fact, I tried bringing the useless items from the first room--the clamp, saw, hammer--to the next room because I thought they might have some secret use.  TL;DR: Atmosphere was awesome, felt like the secret child of Outlast and Amnesia. Puzzles could be a bit more complex and could have more efficient design so they'd be more about brainwork than trying to find the right items in the environment.  (spoilers end)  If I have some spare money at the time, I'm definitely gonna be one of the first to buy the theoretical sequel. I hope the overwhelmingly positive feedback encourages the developer to produce a full game.

While I do recommend this game, and like the overall gameplay of it. It was set up like your actions matter, but they don't. It's not a game, or a mystery on what happened or how to prevent a 'Bad ending' You just merely on a ride to the ultimate ending which cannot be changed. If you want to be left unsatisfied, feeling like there is something missing, or you didn't get all the clues, then don't play this. There are so many options, tools, and ways to get through the game, but none of em matter. Cause the ending never changes.
I advice you test the game

What a game, i loved that you had to search for inventive ways to get out of the house.  I rate this a big 9/10 because the story and the constant thrill i felt though, I there was 1 big scare for me.  You should trie this out.

This Game is not perfect i can tell you this , but is it worth it ? yes of course ! finally a developer out there that knows how to do level design and select the perfect music for it !  Keep it up guys , the voice acting is also on spot !  do more of those , never go big publisher , NEVER
Blameless was a fun game well worth the time to play and enjoy. I wish it had more endings and more story but it is a free game.
its not bad.
great game. fun little finds. good for family and friends
tHIS GAME IS SOME MOTHA ♥♥♥♥ING ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T!
Best 12 minutes of horror ever.
im having issues with the loading screen when i press enter like it told me too nothing happens is that a normal thing to happen? or is something broke?
A GAME OF YOU BEING BLAMELESS OR ARE YOU'INSERT LIE'
Runs well on my old PC, solid story, a bit creepy since you wait for a jump scare that may or may not come, and some puzzles that's not to hard.  If you make a longer game, I'd pay for it.
simple story simple game simple review 10/10 for me
It's a good game but it's small be nice if you make a new one and it be longer and have more jump scares
Creepy! I really liked it!
I had fun, very creepy atmosphere and cool story. It's worth a playthough no doubt.

This is an interesting game with about an hour of gameplay if you want all the achievements. It is mediocrely scary with only one small jumpscare. Considering its free with no IAP this is quite a nice game. Kudos to the developer

This game is quite good. The voice acting is amazing and spot on. The graphics were very very impresive and the mechanics quite interesting. I really enjoyed the puzzles, too me a while to find the attic hatch, mainly beause I was playing with the vise and the light a bit too much. The 'crafting' element is pretty neat too, fixing the bolt cutters and opening the attic.  Atmospherically, this game is very well made, the music and sounds build up the atmosphere very well. However the game doesn't break the atmosphere, it doesn't release the tension that it builds up. It is a horror game and it should give you active scares not only make you think that something is going to happen because lights went out or the music changed.  The ending was very nice in my opionion. Enjoyed it.  Overall you should definatly give this game a try, it is fun, short and enjoyable.  P.S: Why would you keep the keys in a lock? I spent a good 20-30 minutes trying to find keys for the garage door after opening the 'outhouse'.
It's a good game but it's small be nice if you make a new one and it be longer and have more jump scares
A very unique horror game with plenty of challanging puzzles, shame that there are only two endings that result in the same thing.

Really good. It is so thrilling tring to find out what happens and how to get out. The only things that I don't like are:  1. You walk super slow. You walk while crouching faster then you can walk. 2. The game is pretty short. I would suggest making it a bit longer and/or expand the story and/or have something that comes after you escape. Like splitting it into acts. Act 1 could be you escaping.
A neat little Amnesia-type game that you can beat in under half an hour. Great game, especially for free

Game is FREE.Took me about 15-20 mins to Win.I know to make a game of this type, would take weeks or maybe a month.Good start to a game tho.Add more hrs to the game, and you could sell a game like this,GJ Mr. Dev. Keep up the good work,Add more to the game and ill play more, Ty for your time to make us what you did :)

I thought it was pretty good. The puzzles and stragedy are not too hard to figure out. The graphics were very detailed for an indie game. Overall, I really liked it! I wish it was a little longer and developers should consider making it into a mini series or episodes or something. ;-)
I really like that game its scary not as scary as amnesia but the graphics are really good !
a nice litte game to kill some time. but a hard final.

Im not sure where to start with this, this game is sort of mediocre to me. But here is my list of pros and cons to summarize my review.  Pros:  -Graphics are great even on the lowest setting  -Puzzles that challenge your mind -The game is free to play -Creepy atmosphere -Smooth, moderate framerate -Compelling story  Cons: -Some textures are rough on the edges -Terrible voice acting(almost near Tommy Wiseau bad) -Most items in-game a pointless and don't contribute to the puzzles, making it confusing and frustrating when trying them -The game is too short, about 15 minutes for my run   I can see this game having potential. If you are a fan of horror and detective/mystery games, then this one is for you. I do hope this is only some type of demo or small chapter, cause I really want to see how the whole story unfolds on a greater scale!
Great Story....and sound efects THRILLING...<3<3

Great little short adventure story Vaclav! Make more like this! I actually really like the concept of maybe having shorter Anthology-like episodes of short stories.  The atomstphere was great. Puzzles simple but several have multiple solutions. VO okay.

I've always been a sucker for horror/puzzle/mystery games, e.g. Amnesia etc. etc. The moment I saw this game I decided to give it a shot, it's free to play too so I had nothing to lose, I thought to myself. Turns out, what I did lose was my time because the game for me was so bugged, I couldn't pick up tools needed in the very first room of the game, and some weren't even there for me to see.  I did consult a walkthrough after about 30 minutes stuck in the first 'puzzle', even though I despise that when it comes to games like this one, and in the videos the game was working fine for those people. Long story short, after about 6 restarts and new games, the game never worked properly for me. So, if you're feeling lucky, give it a shot, hopefuly it'll work for you. Sadly, I can't review the game's content itself since I never got to actually play it, so all I can do now is give this one a thumbs down and wish you all best of luck.

Very enjoyable short game! Tense all the way through with a major focus on puzzle and short story with some horror aspects in it as well. Great for if you are looking for a fun game to play at night that is not very time consuming. Definately reccommend it considering that it is free.
This was great! I enjoyed it very much, along with my niece who played it with me. Awesome mystery puzzle.
tHIS GAME IS SOME MOTHA ♥♥♥♥ING ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T!

While playing I experienced chills throughout, it felt like something was going to jump out at any second. This game has a brilliant atmosphere, it doesn't rely on cheap jumpscares and impossible monsters, it has a thriving story and great gameplay to keep you on your toes.  First-person adventure isn't dead and I hope I see more titles such as this.

I spend too much time playing this game. At first i had one think: It looks creepy, so it could be a good game to play at 3am. But that was dissapointment. Waste of time but the beggining of game was rly good.

Wow this game was amazing. I am an avid horror game player and don't usually get on edge and super tense during a horror game but this game definitly got me to curl up into a little ball in my chair and pray to god that it would stop. 10/10 One of the best indigames ive seen in a while, really good for a youtube video

Pretty nice atmosphere and story, quality visuals and sounds. Not hard to resolve puzzles. I really enjoyed it. Its is free so it is short of course. I really would like to see the story goes on, need to kill that bastared murderer who is responsible for these events.

Even though this is very short, I thought it was a very interesting first person game. Being able to explore and find the right tools you need to escape the house is one of the aspects I like the most. You inspect everything, almost like you're a crime scene investigator. The man that appears made me jump I admit...   Overall I think this is definitely worth a playthrough for those who like first person Adventure/Psychological Horror games.

not alot of gameplay maybe 15-20 minutes if you know what you're doing but this is a really good game for a quick playthrough. The suspense tended to scare me at times but it quickly subsided and became completely bearable. 10/10 overall really good!

This is a great gift to people looking into the Horror/Puzzle genre. It's a pretty brief timekiller. The saving mechanic at the beginning froze my game a couple times, but I gave it one more shot and decided to be patient. The game sorted itself out and I was able to play a great game. Excellent opening to something much bigger, consider following up!

It has potential for a free game, but it would have need more work. I like the story, even the ending. It shows the frustration of a very real situation. Believe it or not, there are tons of wrongly sentenced people, no matter how good a law system seems to be. The physics, graphics, sounds seem to work pretty well. Of course there are flaws here and there. For example, if you put the saw in the beginning on the table, you'll see it sunk in and the blade disappeared. Also, the logic is seriously funny. I have to find a key to open a padlock while I just need to grab a hammer or a crow bar and disable it just fine? I don't know what material the doors are but I guess it's either wood or plastic, and I'm pretty sure some of those tools around are pretty strong enough to smash a hole open instead of 'there's no door handle' comment. I know it's a fix ending so they have to make the guy a pansy, but seriously if I wake up in a strange place after a guy knocked me out, I'll be damn sure to keep the strongest weapon I can find by my side, duh. I'll run if the bad guy has a gun or something that looks like a scary weapon, but a wooden stick? My god the horror logic LOL Anyway, it's a not so bad game, but can be frustration as I was stuck at the beginning not knowing what I was supposed to do and had to look up the discussions. The ending seems promising a sequel, I hope there is one.

Blameless is a free first person horror puzzle game created by one person. It takes place in a house undergoing renovations and you have to escape. I have almost an hour but that's just because I'm bad at puzzle games. Turn up your brightness in settings by the way/

It's a good game albeit short. The puzzles are great, though the wire cutters did glitch out on me before the recent patch so I'm unsure if that's been fixed. As for the 'horror' elements just a small bit[two] jump scares and that was it. I would like to see this have more rooms to explore and puzzles to solve in through out the house.  But it's free so no harm no foul to try it.
Very good job executing the tension, very fun and challenging puzzles.
Fun game. Suspensful. Sometimes irritating, had to look up a guide for 1 or 2 parts.   P.s. Has absolutely zero replay value.
Great game, very enthralling. I want more!
A great game that delivers! Albeit short, it did manage to reel me in and feel very tense throughout.
i played this and i have to say i loved every second of it. It has everything u want in a horror game!!
An easy and not a boring game. Depends on your knowledge it takes 46 secods or 20 minutes to finish the game.
short but nice game!
Highly recommended. It's nicely made. The voice action is a little off and it's a little short but it's free so I'm not complaining. I wish the developer all the best!
Short, but intriguing little indie game with nifty puzzles! It's a first person adventure game that looks great and very detailed for a free game. Gives you the chills from time to time!
Great atmospore and the puzzles feel satisfying to solve
Bought a 10 random steam key code from G_2_A.. This was one of them and I come here to see it's free...  THANKS G_2_A YA FKN SCAM!! <3 ily

Really good atmosphere and graphics. The story is interesting but it could be expanded a bit to give more endings with more variance (since its such a short game).  Overall its a nice game thats free and could be updated to be a really awesome game!

I really liked the graphics and the puzzle type of feeling you get when you mess around with different stuff in the world. I love how you get to interact with two different things at once and make something new come out of it. I would definentaly recommend it to others and friends who really like indie games because im sure they will love Blameless. Also the different endings part of the game makes players come back and play it again which i find a really genuis idea.
Nice quick good puzzle game and its free so you have nothing to lose really

People who are looking for tention, being affraid and looking for 'the next game to scare you' should definetly play this (short) game.  Overall good atmosphere and a nice, stoy driven, first person, suspension horror title, with a little puzzling in between.

This was way better than I anticipated. The puzzles were thought out pretty well and the story left my heart racing whenever I turned a corner. The ending did kind of ♥♥♥♥ me off, but overall, a good game :)
